channel.title: Feedback Please!
channel.description:
Please, someone help me decide on what I should obtain from bestbuy.com, I've seen A LOT of great deals, and I know there are some people on this website that know a lot about computers, here are the two that I was thinking of:
[b]Note: The price limit is $400.00.[/b]
http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Toshiba+-+Satellite+Laptop+/+Intel%26%23174%3B+Core%26%23153%3B+i3+Processor+/+14%22+Display+/+4GB+Memory+/+640GB+Hard+Drive+-+Blue/2809477.p?skuId=2809477&productCategoryId=pcmcat247400050000&cmp=%20%20&lid=abn_sku_1_Laptop%20&%20Netbook%20Computers_SKU_2809477_IMG&id=1218353393671
or
http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Lenovo+-+Laptop+/+AMD+E-Series+Processor+/+15.6%26%2334%3B+Display+/+4GB+Memory+-+Black/3756321.p?skuId=3756321&id=1218429885329

item.title: Feedback Please!
item.dc:creator: @Hash1_Single Hash1 Single
item.description:
@Hash1_Single wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:24, topic:423899”][quote author=Classic_ link=topic=526552.msg3836037#msg3836037 date=1322920555]
Lenovo is an amazing brand, try to get an intel processor though.
[/quote]You do not want an intel processor…amd is a lot more efficient.[/quote]

Confirm, I’m running a quad AMD processor

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback Please!
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:25, topic:423899”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=526552.msg3836638#msg3836638 date=1322950128]

Lenovo is an amazing brand, try to get an intel processor though.
[/quote]You do not want an intel processor…amd is a lot more efficient.

Then it’s official! I’m getting this laptop for Christmas.[/quote]
Tell me, an Intel proccesor, lets say the Newer pentium, is less efficient than another amd? give me an example.

Read full topic

I didn’t look at specs, just giving my input on good name brands.

item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:16, topic:423899”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=526552.msg3835842#msg3835842 date=1322890214]

Can’t you just build a better one for lower/similar price? :o

This is for Christmas, if they don’t get the exact computer I ask for, there stupid for not listening to me.
[/quote]I laughed :o :rolleyes:[/quote]
Well it’s true, if parents don’t listen to me, it’ll be a terrible computer because they don’t know a thing about computers. I at least have a decent knowledge of computers.

item.title: Feedback Please!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:12, topic:423899”]First one for sure, and yes windows 7, Microsoft stop supporting xp with updates.[/quote] for a LAPTOP , xp is best no matter what. and actually you can still get all the updates up to until they stopped. for a pc that has like…6gb of ram or more sure windows 7 can be your friend.

Think about it like this…

Windows 7 = about 45 processes running on average AFTER you take out the unneeded ones.
Windows xp = about 15 processes running on average if you know what your doing

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback Please!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Loveandpower:

Exactly, that is why I suggested the AMD. AMD is well known for having better processor performance in general. If you are going for top speed with no lag as well, you should wipe it of any Windows 7 copies and use Windows XP Pro/Windows ME. (assuming it will be used for a vps of some sorts mostly)

I thought Windows 7 is a lot better than Windows XP? I would imagine a lot of bug fixes happened during this update.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback Please!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Exactly, that is why I suggested the AMD. AMD is well known for having better processor performance in general. If you are going for top speed with no lag as well, you should wipe it of any Windows 7 copies and use Windows XP Pro/Windows ME. (assuming it will be used for a vps of some sorts mostly)

item.title: Feedback Please!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:423899”]AMD E-Series Processor

^ while it isn’t the best processor out there, AMD is probably the type of processor you want for gaming purposes in general.

Overall though, the type of features you get with the toshiba honestly isn’t worth it. You could build that same laptop for half of that price if not less. For the Lenovo laptop the price is…fair but still a little higher in my opinion.[/quote]
Just at least want so it doesn’t lag like a little fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: Feedback Please!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:7, topic:423899”][quote author=r0ckstar96 link=topic=526552.msg3835813#msg3835813 date=1322889064]
Lenovo man… Lenovo
[/quote]

Apologies… I thought the first link was Lenovo… so is the SECOND link good then?[/quote]AMD E-Series Processor

^ while it isn’t the best processor out there, AMD is probably the type of processor you want for gaming purposes in general.

Overall though, the type of features you get with the toshiba honestly isn’t worth it. You could build that same laptop for half of that price if not less. For the Lenovo laptop the price is…fair but still a little higher in my opinion.

Read full topic
